title: Nimbus clipper addon
content:
Dear Firefox team,

I'm a big fan of your browser! I also really enjoy using the Nimbus platform, but unfortunately their web clipper seems not to work with you like it does with other browsers.

It would be really nice, if the issue could be fixed! The Nimbus team seems to struggle finding out what the issue might be, so it would be very appreciated if there could be a solution you could tell them about. I would love to stay with Firefox, your browser is awesome!

Eagerly waiting for your reply :)
creator: oscar.direkt

title: How to stop address bar/search from defaulting to the most popular site?
content:
So it used to be that when I started typing in the address bar, it would autofill with my most visited site after the first letter or two, which was very handy and a good feature. Since an update a while back, though, that seems to have been replaced with autofilling whatever the most popular search is. I used to be able to just hit p and go automatically to a site I frequently visit, but now it automatically sends me to pinterest. I don't have pinterest. I don't want or like pinterest. I filter pinterest out of my searches. There's absolutely no reason for my search bar to be autofilling to pinterest. I've already got sponsored suggestions disabled so it's not that.

I'm getting really tired of accidentally going to pinterest due to muscle memory (and, presumably, reinforcing that suggestion by accident). Haven't been able to find a setting that turns it off. Would really, really like to.
creator: patchtheincinerator

title: Wifi Repeater suddenly refused access after one month
content:
Firstly, I have a brain injury. I am easily overwhelmed by information and am slow to understand - especially anything to do with I.T.

Recently, I began successfully accessing the internet / Firefox via my Wifi Repeater. As of two or three days ago. I keep being asked to "log in to access the Internet", but even after I do it (successfully, as far as my repeater is concerned) I'm no further forward; I keep being asked to log in.

Thanks to my repeater I have a strong signal when in my garden office. But after a month, Firefox has suddenly stopped allowing me to use it. I am back at Square 1, before I purchased the thing.

I need need to work from my office. Please help resume my Repeater's access.

Kind regards,

Sean
creator: seanhindle4

title: POCKET

Respectfully,

title: File download always fails
content:
No matter what type, size or source of file I try to download, the download invariably fails withn 30 seconds of starting. Once it fails, retrying the download gets me another piece of the file until the download fails again. To get the file to completion, I have to retry numerous times until it gets to the end. If I have multiple files downloading simulteneouly, that requires dedicated man-management to ensure all of them are fully saved.

Having to accompany any download like that is highly annoying and takes time and attenition away performing other tasks in my browsing session. On the same Windows 10 PC, I do not encounter similar issues using other browsers to try to download the same file - it's a one-click, fire-ans-forget process there. I even recently reset my Windows installation and then reinstalled a fresh copy of Firefox (my favourite browser to use) but this annoying issue persists.

Can anyone help?
creator: Scotty.Ranking
